text.p:
ALEX . MACLAREN & SONS
268 ARGYLE STREET , C . 2

FINGAL IN THE HOUSE OF BLAR BUIDHE
WITHOUT THE POWER OF SITTING DOWN OR RISING UP .

GLASGOW :
ALEX . MACLAREN & SONS ,
268 ARGYLE STREET , C . 2 .

Fionn ann an tigh a ’ Bhlair - Bhuidhe
GUN CHOMAS EIRIGH NO SUIDHE

THIS tale was written down by the late Mr Donald C . Macpherson , of the Advocates ’ Library , Edinburgh , and the reciter was Mr Macpherson ’ s own grandmother . It was contributed by Mr J . F . Campbell of Islay , “ Ian Og Ile , ” to the “ Revue Celtica , ” in 1870 , and was afterwards reprinted in the “ Gael ” of January , 1875 . It has also been included in a volume of Readings compiled by Professor Mackinnon of Edinburgh in 1889 , and was again published some years ago as a small text book with an English translation by Mr J . G . Mackay , of London .

Variations of the tale have been collected and published by the Rev . Jas . Macdougall in “ Folk and Hero Tales , ” and by the Rev . John G . Campbell of Tiree in a volume of “ The Fians . ” There are other versions given under different titles , “ Maghach Colgar , ” Volume II . , West Highland Tales and “ Leabhar na Feinne , ” pp . 86 - 88 .
